title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at PeaceHealth (Vancouver, WA)
Interview Descriptions: Didn't happen. I was not interviewed. I didn't complete the application. I didn't load my resume or complete the paperwork. I decided I was not going to apply. I decided to keep my current position
Interview Questions: They didn't ask me anything

title: Administrative Fellow Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at PeaceHealth (Vancouver, WA)
Interview Descriptions: The screening interview is first. There will be one week before the decision is made if you're invited to the panel interview. The panel interview with leadership and current/past Administrative Fellows is second. Expect a call with a decision two weeks after the second interview.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in joining PeaceHealth?

title: Certified Nurse Midwife (CNM) Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at PeaceHealth (Bellingham, WA) in Apr 2023
Interview Descriptions: Applied online and received response from recruiter within about 3-5 days. Initial contact by the recruiter via a phone call, followed by a phone call from the lead CNM in the Bellingham, WA area.
Interview Questions: How many deliveries have you had?

title: Network Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. I interviewed at PeaceHealth
Interview Descriptions: The recruiter was very helpful and kept me updated along the way. I had several interviews, some with a group and one onsite interview. Everyone was very kind and explained everything along the way.
Interview Questions: Had multiple interviews done via Teams.

title: Coder Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at PeaceHealth
Interview Descriptions:
Fast phone interview followed by a test with offer in quick succession. 
Offer is at least $2-3 below market rate. Promises of promoting within, but reviews here state otherwise and unwilling to formalize a plan. Recruiter **illegally** suggested I should not have discussed the offer/salary with hiring manager which is against labor laws.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Human Resources Generalist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at PeaceHealth
Interview Descriptions: Two step interview process. First interview is with Human Resources to make sure you meet the requirements of the position. The second interview is with the department manager who asks more in-depth questions
Interview Questions: Can you give me an example of a time you worked on a project and it did not go as expected?

title: Applications Systems Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at PeaceHealth (Auburn, WA) in Jun 2022
Interview Descriptions:
Wonderful.
HR reached out to me, within 2 day TAT after applying.  Hiring Manager reached out to me next day.  Had 3 group interviews in 2 days total, and offer was next day.  Onboarding is very informative, the team, the management, the staff so far are amazing, they are supportive and great personality with one another.
Interview Questions:
experience with the different applications?
troubleshooting scenarios
leadership scenario

title: Financial Clearance Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at PeaceHealth (Vancouver, WA) in Feb 2022
Interview Descriptions: Questions were way out of the box. Panel interview. I was totally prepared for what my greatest weakness and strength or achievements. Name 3 people that changed your life and why? Name 3 people who’s life you changed and why?
Interview Questions: Name 3 people who’s life you changed for the better?

title: Patient Navigator Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at PeaceHealth (Eugene, OR) in Dec 2021
Interview Descriptions: Received contact within 2 weeks of applying for the position. Had an initial phone conversation in order to get information about the job which then I expressed interest and was given an interview within a week. It was a 3 person panel asking the same typical questions. Had a good vibe from them and felt they liked what I said. 2 weeks passed and I emailed them to see if they had made a decision the next day I got an email that I was not chosen to move forward. Unsure what they were looking for as I was fully qualified. Oh well!
Interview Questions: What are 3 skills you need to work on?

title: Patient Access Representative Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at PeaceHealth
Interview Descriptions: Friendly, fair, professional, polite. The job description was well written.  The position duties and expected responsibilities were explained.  There were many questions solely pertaining to my resume, which made me feel like they were considering me and took interest in my background.
Interview Questions: Why did I apply for the position.  What qualifications did I have

title: Patient Access Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at PeaceHealth (Vancouver, WA) in Nov 2021
Interview Descriptions: Took awhile to get an interview, about a month after I placed my application till I received a call for the first interview. 1st interview was over the phone, not terribly long and the experience was great and she was very friendly. 2nd interview was via zoom and was also a good experience. They asked good questions that allowed them to learn about me but also welcomed me to ask questions to learn about the job and Peace Health.
Interview Questions: Tell us why you would want this job?

title: Receptionist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at PeaceHealth
Interview Descriptions: The telephone interview was very pleasant. Discussed essential job functions and asked appropriate questions. Very polite and informative. I'm just trying to get 30 words in so I can see stuff.
Interview Questions: Many questions were asked, all very relative.

title: HR Business Partner Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at PeaceHealth (Vancouver, WA) in Sept 2021
Interview Descriptions: The Recruiter did not say her name. She starts talking about the position and how it should work. She said about salary and ask me about myself and if I had any questions.  She talked for 4 minutes and asked 2 questions. It is really fast.
Interview Questions: She said: Tell me about yourself.

title: Strategic Communications Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at PeaceHealth in Jul 2021
Interview Descriptions: Initial interview with Director of Strategic Communications, which was pleasant. Second round was three parts with three different parts of the team. Everyone was pleasant and seemed to enjoy their jobs.
Interview Questions: Standard questions: What is one recent project you've worked on that you were proud of, and why? Etc, etc.

title: Risk Management Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at PeaceHealth (Eugene, OR) in Jul 2021
Interview Descriptions: I interviewed for a risk mgmt position. Had 4 interviews., all terrific and reasonable questions, I was then offered the job only to have them call and retract in less than an hour. It was the hiring mgr and she made the recruiter call me. Nobody else was told ( her director nor the person I would report to).  After this I was told they wanted experience in 2 areas not in the job description! They ask me q on morals but they clearly didn’t show me any respect nor integrity. I dodged a bullet.
Interview Questions: Allot of behavioral questions were ask of me.

title: Physical Therapist Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at PeaceHealth (Eugene, OR) in Jun 2021
Interview Descriptions: I had a wonderful informational interview this summer.  They provided me with a lot of great information regarding ways to boost my resume for the position I want  and were very encouraging.  I will keep them in mind for future employment.
Interview Questions: As an informational interview, I posed most of the questions, but they were interested in learning a bit about me as well.

title: Medical Coder Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at PeaceHealth
Interview Descriptions: Panel question type of interview, it was supposed to be 3 people but one person wasn't able to make it. Questions were typical interview questions. Interview was about an hour long.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Sleep Medicine Physician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at PeaceHealth in Mar 2021
Interview Descriptions: Locums position was discussed. NOT sure why but it was very abrupt. The manager was not quite sure about the job requirements. I was very polite and receptive from my end.
Interview Questions: Salary/ compensation rate was discussed.

title: Compliance Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at PeaceHealth
Interview Descriptions: I worked with the organization to schedule a lengthy and lively interview. There was positive give-and-take throughout the interview with a commitment from the interview to follow up.  Unfortunately, the company ghosted me without any follow-up, including even a notification that I would not proceed with further interviews.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Phlebotomist Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at PeaceHealth (Springfield, OR) in Feb 2021
Interview Descriptions:
Quick and simple questions  the interview was very nice and made me feel at ease . Very informative about the duties of the job .

The interviewer was on time and the interview was a decent length
Interview Questions: Why I would fit in at the hospital

title: Register Nurse Medical Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at PeaceHealth
Interview Descriptions:
Contacted by recruiter. Follow up by Multiple other.  Online interview  with software that needed to be uploaded. meeting was during daytime.  two people interviewing. They were
 not prepared. Ended with we will get back to you.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for this hospital ?

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at PeaceHealth
Interview Descriptions: It was a brief panel interview in which the supervisors shared about their interest in their work, and asked me about mine. We also discussed optimal schedule, and available duties were somewhat vague.
Interview Questions: What would you like to get out of this internship?

title: Accountant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at PeaceHealth
Interview Descriptions: I had one short 30 minute interview on site during COVID-19 pandemic where the two company employees asked me to take off my mask indoors during the interview, which is against company policy.
Interview Questions: They asked about my work background and experience.

title: Program Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at PeaceHealth (Eugene, OR) in Jan 2021
Interview Descriptions: Specific and to the point. Well organized and good questions - knew my experience and questions related directly to the application submitted. Timely and friendly interviewer. Length was good - not too strenuous.
Interview Questions: How would you manage a communication challenge?

title: RN New Grad Residency Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at PeaceHealth in Nov 2020
Interview Descriptions:
Received an email with a listed interview date/time with a unit interested in interviewing me. You could deny or accept the interview.
Went through a virtual Zoom interview with the interested unit hiring team.
The team asked me 5 questions that seemed to be standard for their New Grad interviews.
Interview Questions:
Tell us about yourself.
Why did you go into nursing?
Give an example of a time when...
Why do you want to work in this unit?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at PeaceHealth
Interview Descriptions: One on one with floor manager hiring for the position, started with a get to know you and then HR questions that required thought and were fairly difficult to answer, however , the interview was relatively laid back and the manager was really friendly.
Interview Questions: What is one thing you did to help your team reach a goal.

title: Program Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at PeaceHealth in Aug 2020
Interview Descriptions: There was a panel and they asked various questions pertaining to my past work experience, my skills, and what my motivations are for the job.  It was a very pleasant experience.
Interview Questions: What project I have worked on that had a positive financial outcome for the organization?

title: Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at PeaceHealth in Jul 2020
Interview Descriptions: Very friendly and collegial, not rushed, structured but also light and informal, comfortable while remaining focused, felt like chatting with colleagues with some structure and focus, interviewed with several people at once over video, process was smooth
Interview Questions: Where do I see myself in 5 years?

title: RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at PeaceHealth
Interview Descriptions: I interviewed for the residency program. It was a panel interview, I think a total of 4 or 5 people were on the panel and each person took a turn asking a question.  It lasted probably about 20 minutes.
Interview Questions: Why do you think you are the best candidate for the job?

title: Radiologic Technologist Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. I interviewed at PeaceHealth (Vancouver, WA)
Interview Descriptions: The mission is important. They tell you what you want to hear. They are desperate for any good techs but they only get garbage techs. You'll get hired no problem.
Interview Questions: Do you know what are mission is?

title: Fundraising Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at PeaceHealth (Bellingham, WA) in Feb 2020
Interview Descriptions: I applied online, heard back from a recruiter about a week later. Recruiter completed quick phone interview, forwarded me to hiring manager, then an in person interview. The interview consisted of a 1:1 with the hiring manager, than an interview with the staff from that office, followed by a tour of the facility.
Interview Questions: Please describe the best fundraising team you have ever worked for.

title: Respiratory Therapist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at PeaceHealth (Springfield, OR) in Dec 2019
Interview Descriptions: Really easy and laid back! Had a phone interview and was asked character and scenario questions. Let your personality shine! Take notes and be prepared. They’re very nice and understanding if you are nervous!
Interview Questions: What is a weakness/ something someone would misunderstand about you?

title: Operating Room Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at PeaceHealth (Portland, OR) in Sept 2019
Interview Descriptions: Favoritism and discrimination. Management only promotes friends, encourages gossip, and violates HIPPA constantly. Bad reputation with locals. Pay is less than most hospitals. Constantly turning over staff. Supervisors are childish and cruel.
Interview Questions: Nothing. When can you start. A bad sign to begin with.

title: Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at PeaceHealth (Vancouver, WA) in Jun 2019
Interview Descriptions: Very fast interview. New supervisor,  felt he was unsure of himself. It was one on one in conference room.   He informed me by phone, he chose to "go another route".
Interview Questions: What animal would you choose to be and why? What star would you be and why? Why should I hire you?

title: Cook Interview
Application Type: The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at PeaceHealth (Vancouver, WA) in Mar 2019
Interview Descriptions: It was easy and lame. The guy that interviewed obviously had no knowledge of “cooking” at all. Pretty much pointless. They ask you stupid questions that you can clearly see on the resume.
Interview Questions: They didn’t ask me anything

title: Lpn Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at PeaceHealth
Interview Descriptions: First there was a phone interview. During the phone interview she explained the position more in depth. She also explained the hiring process.  She wanted to know my background, and what kind of nursing I was familiar with.
Interview Questions: What makes you want to work for Peace Health?

title: MA Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at PeaceHealth (Vancouver, WA) in Jan 2019
Interview Descriptions: Interview was strange. They didn't ask typical questions. Never had an interview like this before. Not sure what I applied to???? Very unprofessional, but at least I was calm, laugh out loud.
Interview Questions: How would I make a tuna fish sandwich?

title: Provider Liaison Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at PeaceHealth (Vancouver, WA)
Interview Descriptions: Submitted resume and job application.  Had a series of phone interviews, followed by one panel interview and then two more job interviews in person.  Was impressed with the managers and team members that I interviewed with and felt confident in moving forward in the process.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in this position.

title: PMO Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at PeaceHealth (Vancouver, WA) in Dec 2018
Interview Descriptions: Very professional.  Phone interview with hiring manager about 30 mins.  Excellent questions.  I was added to the in person interview list - confirmed via email within 2 days.  Details on timing, location, etc. all provided well in advance.  They created their own summary of my experience (probably for consistency across candidates) and let me review/comment prior to interview.  Two panels of 2-3 people representing different groups interviewed me for an hour each back to back.  Follow up in person brief interview with hiring manager.  Within 5 days a decision was made and emailed to me.
Interview Questions: Situational questions - Can you provide an example of when you had to... and how did you handle it.  Questions were written and consistent between all candidates.

title: Physical Therapy Aide Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at PeaceHealth (Eugene, OR) in Nov 2018
Interview Descriptions: I received a call with a short interview with the physical therapist talking about the position and what it entails. Then, there was about an hour in-person interview with 2 physical therapists. They offered to have me shadow  a current PT aide for a few hours after the interview.
Interview Questions: What do you if you're working with a therapist and a patient is about to fall?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. I interviewed at PeaceHealth (Vancouver, WA) in Oct 2018
Interview Descriptions: Interview was straight and simple to the point. What my role would like day to day. Talked about my past experience and what I have done that will contribute to the work field. I was in the emergency department, assisting nurses and patient admin. It was a good experience and gained new skills.
Interview Questions: How would you adapt in an urgent environment? How quickly can you adjust to changes?

title: Nurse Residency Program Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at PeaceHealth (Bellingham, WA)
Interview Descriptions: Applied online, received an email to complete an online portfolio-type-thing with some standard interview questions. Got an email and a phone call to set up an interview time. The interview was a panel, received a phone call the following week with an offer.
Interview Questions: Tell us about a time when you had a disagreement with a co-worker, and how did you resolve it.

title: Administrative Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at PeaceHealth
Interview Descriptions: Group interview with key team members.  Very informative.  Open to answering questions.  Very positive experience.  Nothing negative to report.  Just complete the STAR report about the company and you will be fine.
Interview Questions: What do you know about our vision and mission?

title: Social Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at PeaceHealth
Interview Descriptions: Easy, low key process. There are set questions at the beginning for both departments I interviewed with  but one was more low key than the other. Depends on the department and the number of people in the interveiw.
Interview Questions: There are some consistent questions asked across PeaceHealth such as your alignment with their mission and values, etc.  Then when I met the team, there were no set questions. Very relaxed and spontaneous.

title: Certified Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at PeaceHealth (Eugene, OR) in Apr 2018
Interview Descriptions: The interview is a bit hurried but professional. I was asked a lot of questions. I had did a lot of prep time so I asked a few questions about the company and how it is to work for. I was offered a position. The hiring process  after you accepted the offer is a lot of paperwork and days of classes.
Interview Questions: What is your weakness and how do you feel about it?

title: Audio Visual Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at PeaceHealth (Vancouver, WA) in Apr 2018
Interview Descriptions:
Initial phone interview > On-site interview > follow up interview.

Had the opportunity to meet the core team working with this position. 

Was given overview of culture of company, department, and specific team.

Given thorough overview of position, both positive and challenging aspects. Given specific potential scenarios of tasks that would be expected.
Interview Questions: How would you respond to a C-level executive bypassing the ticketing system and sending a technical request directly to you via Teams (chat)?

title: Behavioral Health Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at PeaceHealth (Bellingham, WA)
Interview Descriptions: The first interview was a 1:1 with the Department Supervisor. It was pretty laid back and she asked me questions about my work experience, education, training/skills, etc. The second interview was a panel type interview. Several employees were present at the interview and asked questions/gave scenerios for me to respond to. There was also a "tell about yourself/your experience" segment.
Interview Questions: They asked me how comfortable I was dealing with physically aggressive patients? If I was comfortable assisting with physical restraints?

title: HIM Specialist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at PeaceHealth
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed to review work history and type of medical records that we processed to patient records.  It was a interesting job and work load varied daily, but it was rewarding.
Interview Questions: How many work hours desired

title: Pharmacy Resident Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at PeaceHealth (Vancouver, WA) in Feb 2018
Interview Descriptions: Interview with several clinical preceptors, separate interview with the residency program director, a tour of the hospital and facilities, lunch with current residents. There was also ample time to ask questions about the program from the preceptors, residency director, as well as the current residents during lunch.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to be a resident at PeaceHealth?

title: Security Officer Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at PeaceHealth (Bellingham, WA) in Jan 2018
Interview Descriptions: To start I was invited to take a written test relative to the job specific functions.  Once I passed that test I was invited back to a formal interview with the manager, supervisor and a manager of the risk management department.  I feel that all of the questions were well formed and required some critical thinking.  The management staff were all very professional and open to questions at the end of the interview.
Interview Questions: Describe a time where you had to enforce a policy that you did not necessarily agree with.

title: Rehab Aide Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at PeaceHealth
Interview Descriptions: Three people interviewed me in a small office off the side of the therapy gym.  I got a tour on the way out.  I was introduced to one other Rehab Aide.
Interview Questions: How do I feel about working in an environment that changes all the time?

title: Certified Nursing Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at PeaceHealth (Vancouver, WA) in Feb 2017
Interview Descriptions: Excellent among two excellent clinical managers. The process was a bit easier for me because I was essentially considered an internal applicant, so I was just transitioning over into another department from vendor to actual employee of the company.
Interview Questions: Explain a time where you had conflict, how did you resolve it?

title: RN Case Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at PeaceHealth (Bellingham, WA) in Feb 2017
Interview Descriptions: Panel of managers did my interview. They were friendly and direct. Interview did not seem intimidating. I enjoyed the process. Great place to work. They take great care of their employees.
Interview Questions: What within our mission do you find meaning with and align with?

title: Patient Access Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at PeaceHealth (Longview, WA) in Jul 2016
Interview Descriptions: One on one interview with Office Manager for the particular department I applied for. Was called 1 hour after the interview to move forward with the hiring process. Took 1 week to hear from HR with official job offer. Then sent paperwork to fill out and fax, sent for drug screen and background test. Overall hiring process took about one month, was told that was very standard. Was fine for me and my situation, but can see how it may be negative for some.
Interview Questions: Having read our mission statement, what did you agree with, or was resonated with you.

title: Advertising Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at PeaceHealth (Vancouver, WA) in Apr 2016
Interview Descriptions: Well executed interview process with multiple team members across multiple departments. The questions were well thought out and applied to the specific position I was applying for. All team members within the interview had a chance to ask questions.
Interview Questions: How have you directly saved your company money?

title: Administrative Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at PeaceHealth (Springfield, OR) in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions: I first had a phone interview with Alice and her assistant. It was basic questions about strengths, prioritizing, handling conflict, etc. I got a call back to come in for a second interview with the supervisors. This was a little more stressful as there were three people interviewing me at a conference table with Alice listening in the corner. I also had a computer test where I had to recreate a Word and Excel document.
Interview Questions: What's the most difficult situation you ever experienced on the job?

title: Release of Information Specialist Interview
Application Type: The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at PeaceHealth (Vancouver, WA) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions:
First contact was an email from the hiring manager to schedule an in-person interview. 

Lengthy in-person interview 

Offer was next followed by their request for 3-5 work related references. You send an email with a link to these people to complete a questionnaire. You can view the questions but not the responses and you can track who has responded. 3 references are required before you can advance to the offer stage. 

Drug screen and background check after the offer is made.
Interview Questions: What are the components if a medical record

title: Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at PeaceHealth (Vancouver, WA) in Nov 2015
Interview Descriptions: Drove 4 miles one way in a torrential rain storm. No one asked how was my drive. Got stuck in a room for 5 hours with a multitude of staff coming in throughout the interview process. The dept. supervisors were the worse interviewees. They were very stuffy, did not smile or even care that I was there. Got a standardized reject letter from HR. My Qualifications far exceeded the position requirements. I felt they discriminated based on my age. The position is still vacant. Don't know any qualified person in their right mind who would work for this facility.
Interview Questions: Basic interview questions

title: Senior Financial Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at PeaceHealth (Bellingham, WA)
Interview Descriptions: I originally applied for an Analyst position.  I was phone screened by HR then interviewed with the department manager.  While in my first interview I was informed of another, Sr analyst position, for which I also applied and was interviewed. I then had a second interview for the second position with a member of leadership, not in the direct reporting structure.  Both departments offered me a position. Their was a brief 'bidding war' with the 2nd position finally offering $10K more than the first.
Interview Questions: How do you see your first 90 days of employment?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at PeaceHealth (Springfield, OR) in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions: Applied within the PeaceHealth Careers section, contacted by Nurse Manager and set up the interview for the next week. Talent Acquisition acted as the middle man between me and the nurse manager to confirm FTE and which shift. Then I got the confirmation for job offer after back and forth emails and phone calls from Talent Acquisition.
Interview Questions: How do you handle stressful situations?

title: Communications Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at PeaceHealth
Interview Descriptions:
Applied online and received a call back about a month later to schedule a phone interview. Phone interview went well. Took about 30 minutes. Three PeaceHealth interviewers were nice and cordial. All interviewers were from the communications team no HR representative. Standard introductory and probing questions about work history and gaps in employment. 

Interviewers kindly provided more information on the team and job opportunity. Also, appreciated being given time to ask them questions. 

My only negative experience was afterwards. I was told during the phone interview that short-listed candidates would be given a status update within a couple of weeks. But no courtesy call or email about the status of my application ever came during that time. So I followed up myself a month after my phone interview and did receive a response. However, the lack of clarity and timeliness in the response was disappointing. 

I'm unsure if that's just PeaceHealth HR policy/protocol, but applicants do appreciate transparency in the hiring process. I understand people are all busy. If we don't make the stage, please clearly tell us that so there are no misunderstandings and applicants can move on.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Laboratory Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at PeaceHealth (Springfield, OR) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: Friendly discussion of the values of the company and what the experience would be like. Mostly fair warning of the demands required. Warning that carelessness can kill someone in this profession so take it somewhat seriously, but you do not have to be overly dire.
Interview Questions: Last time you attempted something and it didn't go to plan. Time of great stress in one of my resume endeavors. A lot of the fairly standard and well known interview questions.

title: Sleep Technologist Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at PeaceHealth (Bellingham, WA) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: The interview consisted of two phone interviews and an in person interview.  Questions were asked to determine how well you handled stressful situations with patients as well as with co-workers. They give you a lot of "what if"scenarios and ask you to walk them through how you would handle it.  There weren't any trick questions. It was very important they hear you say you wanted to be a part in building a team.
Interview Questions: How do you deal with difficult co-workers?

title: Par Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at PeaceHealth (Vancouver, WA) in Nov 2014
Interview Descriptions: During the interview and negotiations was guaranteed that my obligations prior to taking this job would be honored. When hired took the promised days off only to later be written up for taking the time off!
Interview Questions: What kind of people you can't get along with? Why kind of people drive you crazy?

title: Patient Access Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at PeaceHealth (Vancouver, WA) in Aug 2014
Interview Descriptions: Submitting of on line application and letter of interest. Received computer confirmation of receipt of application. Wait until position closed.  Panel interview. Submission of drug screen. Background check. Reference check. Employee Health interview and tb screening. Baseline physical. Baseline chest x-ray. Measles screening. Received phone call to set up interview.
Interview Questions: Describe what you would do if a patient hit you.

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at PeaceHealth
Interview Descriptions: The interview was one in-person interview with the head of the department. We went through my resume and explained my previous experience. I didn't have much because I was still a Junior in college. He asked me some behavioral style questions about when I used marketing or social media and  went through work samples.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Medical Technologist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at PeaceHealth in Jul 2014
Interview Descriptions: Communication was great and thorough with HR and supervisor leading up to the interview. Phone interview with supervisor followed by in-person interview. They flew me from out-of-state for the interview so that was quite nice. I had a really pleasant experience. Everyone I met on staff was super nice and easygoing.
Interview Questions: A few "how would you resolve an issue with a coworker" questions as is standard but nothing crazy. Initial screening conducted during phone interview already.

title: Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at PeaceHealth (Vancouver, WA)
Interview Descriptions: Soon after applying a recruiter contacted me, she was really friendly and tried to answer my questions as best she could. The whole process was a little longer than I would have hoped, from application and interview to being hired, but I think it was mainly due to my new manager's having a tight schedule. Everyone was friendly and the background check/drug screen/references were all pretty seamless.
Interview Questions: Describing my career goals and 5-year plan. This is a really tough one for me personally to answer!

title: Registered Respiratory Therapist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at PeaceHealth in Jun 2014
Interview Descriptions: 2 interviews.  RT Manager is a hands on active RT, so questions asked were relevant and current.  I was a bit nervous but he maintained eye contact and was calm and friendly and kept me at ease, making it easier to answer his questions.
Interview Questions: Blood gas interpretations without other information can be challenging when under interview pressure.  They are simple when you are testing or in a clinical setting, but when a job depends on your answer all of the sudden, it became very difficult and everything I knew flew out of my head.

title: Technical Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at PeaceHealth (Springfield, OR) in Jun 2014
Interview Descriptions: Interview questions were previously developed by someone at company and seem to be same for each interview. Interviewer selects question from questionnaire and writes your response as you answer.  At the end, he/she may ask a unique question they have derived.
Interview Questions: How would you handle a difficult employee?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at PeaceHealth
Interview Descriptions: You submit your resume online, it is dumped in with hundreds of others.  It helps if you know someone so that they can tell the hiring manager what name to look for.  If you are lucky enough to get an interview and they like you it can take up to two months to finish the process before they make an offer.
Interview Questions: Describe a situation in which you had a conflict with a co-worker...what did you do?

title: Senior Financial Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at PeaceHealth
Interview Descriptions: The HR staff are very responsive and kind.
Interview Questions: None really.  Having healthcare experience does help.

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at PeaceHealth (Vancouver, WA) in Jan 2014
Interview Descriptions: Panel interview for ICU internship. They took turn asking questions including "How do you handle diversity" "what sets you apart" etc. They interview about 15-30 people for 6 spots. Overall, easy interview if previous experience with panels.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at PeaceHealth (Vancouver, WA) in Dec 2013
Interview Descriptions: There were a total of three interviews. The process was very slow.
Interview Questions: I came prepared and did not experience this.

title: Desktop Support Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at PeaceHealth in Nov 2013
Interview Descriptions: the initial interview was with contractor and employer. Felt very comfortable about the interview. They were focused on customer service in which, I have over 25 years of experience. After the interview I was called with in 15 min and was offered a 6 weeks contract job. It lasted 3 months. My last day with peacehealth is Feb. 14, 2014
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Patient Access Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at PeaceHealth (Bellingham, WA) in Oct 2013
Interview Descriptions: The administrative leads from the Internal Medicine and Family practice sat down with me in a back office room for around 45 minutes.  I sat across the table from the two women and the interview was more conversational than anything else.  Their questions were general and easy to answer, mostly related to experiences I've had working with customers and with teammates in previous jobs.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work in the medical field?

title: Staff Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at PeaceHealth
Interview Descriptions: one interview no problem
Interview Questions: there were no difficult questions

title: Director Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. I interviewed at PeaceHealth (Bellingham, WA) in Aug 2013
Interview Descriptions:
Multiple interviews, from recruiter to HR to senior leadership to staff. Good process, friendly people who seemed highly motivated to get the long-open position filled, 
just not very accurate in how the position was described versus actual.
Interview Questions: Willingness to relocate?

title: Patient Financial Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at PeaceHealth (Vancouver, WA) in Aug 2013
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview with standard questions about strengths, weaknesses, describing situations in which you faced stress and how you dealt with it, describe how you manage priorities and deadlines and what you would do to contribute to the success of the organization.
Interview Questions: How do you deal with stress in the workplace?

title: Laboratory Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at PeaceHealth (Bellingham, WA) in May 2013
Interview Descriptions: Standard interview questions and format. Hiring managers are located in Oregon not at St. Josephs so they never actually meet the interviewees. Their decision is based on written information from the interviewers. There were two managers who interviewed me, which ended up being my immediate supervisors. Also, I wore a suit and I felt as if I had overdressed for the interview.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time when you had a disagreement or altercation with a co-worker and how you resolved it.

title: IT Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at PeaceHealth (Vancouver, WA) in Feb 2013
Interview Descriptions: First was a phone interview by HR.  This appeared to validate my qualification.  Despite my credentialing and experience in the field, the main concern was that my degree was in Music.   Then there was an interview with a panel of my peers.
Interview Questions: How my music degree related to management?

title: Payroll Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at PeaceHealth in Sept 2012
Interview Descriptions: I was a temp to hire so did not interview for the position. When I was hired permanently I was called into HR, they told me the pay rate and it was based on a scale and I did not receive an increase because of the time in the position.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: CNA Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at PeaceHealth in Aug 2012
Interview Descriptions: Applied online and a few short weeks later they called and set up a interview. The interview was pretty standard, it was the manager, assistant manager and a few employees. The turn around was great, as I got a call back the following day with a offer.
Interview Questions: What is your previous experience

title: Insurance Analyst - Underwriting Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at PeaceHealth (Vancouver, WA) in Jul 2012
Interview Descriptions: I applied online, I was contacted by a recruiter about 3 weeks after applying. The Interview was at their service center in Vancouver WA. In person and one person interviewing on the phone in an office. It was awkward as the in person interviewer did no introductions and dove right into personality questions. They did not describe the job at all until about 20 minutes into the interview. there was a person on the phone and it was hard to hear them and understand. It felt very disorganized. They told me to contact them after a few weeks if I never heard from them again. They did not give me a business card. All prior contact was done with a HR specialist in the office. I am sure I could contact that person, however, I don't think this job would be going anywhere. The overall company seems very disorganized and had recently moved from 150 miles away. This job is creating a dept as all the current workers chose not to stay with the company, I think maybe I know why.
Interview Questions: Describe a recent accomplishment?

title: Business Systems Analyst II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at PeaceHealth (Vancouver, WA) in May 2012
Interview Descriptions: It was a quick process, I had 3 interviews in one week, first was the phone interview, next one on one with the manager, last was the group interview with the panel of my peers. Very thorough, situational based questions, also asked technical questions in the very first interview. The HR and Manger were very efficient and communicated great, I knew what was happening at every step of the hiring process.
Interview Questions: Describe a time when you made a mistake, what did you do, and what was the outcome?

title: Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at PeaceHealth (Vancouver, WA) in Mar 2012
Interview Descriptions: Applied online, was a little slow to receive contact from a recruiter but once I did things moved pretty quickly. Went through 2 rounds of interviews with hiring stakeholders, was offered the position and started soon after that. Not a lot of on-the-job training but I was hired into a new role and the people I worked with were friendly and supportive so it was OK!
Interview Questions: Describe a time when you had to juggle multiple deadlines at once

title: Staff RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at PeaceHealth (Eugene, OR) in Jun 2011
Interview Descriptions: The interviewer pretty much read down a list of questions without much variance.  It was just the charge nurse and I.  They asked questions such as where do you see yourself in 5 years, what is your experience, why do you want to work here, tell me a little bit about yourself.
Interview Questions: What do you think of/in what way do you support the mission statement?

title: Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at PeaceHealth (Florence, OR) in Feb 2009
Interview Descriptions:
The hiring manager explained to me that they hired for "fit", or a combination of education, experience, and personality that would best fit into the position they were seeking to fill.  Having any one of those wouldn't qualify me for the job.  Essentially, they literally look for the exact right person to fill the open position-not just anyone who is qualified.  

I was interviewed three times.  Once over the phone by HR, then in person by the department manager, and finally by upper management.

I was hired in the end, however you should be prepared for a wait.  Total time from the initial application to my first day of work was two months.
Interview Questions: Why do you think you would be a good fit for this department?
